View on GitHub

Curriculum

The Open Curriculum for Learning Web Development

Finish

Hopefully you've gained a better idea of what a web developer actually does and what your life might look like if you decided to take it on as a full- or part-time career. See below if you'd like to learn more before moving forward to the next sections, where we install the necessary software and actually begin digging a bit deeper into how computers and the web work.

Additional Resources

Have you run across anything that's really helpful for learning this? Add it here! See our section on How to Contribute.

  • Read this Quora answer if you also want to know what a Product Manager does.
  • Add Here!

Roadmap

  1. Introduction
  2. About Web Developers
    1. What A Web Developer Does
    2. Web Development Jobs and Careers
    3. Tools of the Trade
    4. Web Development Communities
    5. The Best Web Developers
    6. Getting Hired as a Web Developer
    7. Finale
  3. Installations
  4. Pair Programming
    1. Why We Pair
    2. How To Pair
    3. A Sample Pairing Session
    4. Finale
  5. Web Development 101
    1. How Does the Web Work?
    2. How Does Your Computer Work?
    3. Terms to Know
    4. Web Programming Basics
      1. Front End Basics
        1. HTML and CSS Basics
        2. Project: HTML / CSS
        3. Javascript and jQuery Basics
        4. Project: JS and jQuery
      2. Back End Basics
        1. Ruby Basics
        2. Project: Ruby
      3. Databases
      4. Web Development Frameworks
        1. Ruby on Rails
        2. Project: Ruby on Rails
        3. Backbone.js
      5. Tying It All Together
      6. Additional Important Topics
    5. How are Websites Built?
    6. Principles of Good Programming
    7. Other "Dumb" Questions Answered
    8. Finish
  6. Ruby
    1. Basic Ruby
      1. Building Blocks
      2. Project: Building Blocks
      3. Advanced Building Blocks
      4. Project: Advanced Building Blocks
    2. Intermediate Ruby
      1. Object Oriented Programming
      2. Project: OOP
      3. File I/O and Serialization
      4. Project: File I/O and Serialization
    3. Ruby on the Web
      1. Project: Ruby on the Web
    4. Computer Science-y Ruby
      1. Recursion
      2. Project: Recursion
      3. Data Structures and Algorithms
      4. Project: Data Structures and Algorithms
    5. Testing Ruby with RSpec
      1. Project: Testing Ruby
    6. Ruby Final Project
    7. Finale
  7. Git (Coming Soon!)
  8. Databases (Coming Soon!)
  9. Ruby on Rails
  10. HTML and CSS
  11. Javascript
  12. Tying It All Together
